History_of_Present_Illness: 42 yof with no sig. PMH presenting with acute onset abdominal x several hours. Patient reports chronic, periodic abdominal pain x several months. Workup included CT abdomen which showed ileitis and colonoscopy with biopsy which was unrevealing. Stool studies to date have also been unremarkable. She describes the pain as crampy, lasting several seconds before resolving, targeting mid-lower abdomen. She denies any weight loss, fevers, chills, nausea or diarrhea. Each episode lasts around 8 hours before resolving. She cannot identify a clear trigger. GI has been following.
